metadata.name: Epic_Template
metadata.source: Generated based on industry best practices and Context Engineering framework

instructions.guideline: Decompose product vision into independently valuable epics
Each epic should deliver standalone user value
Epics should be sized for 2-3 month implementation
Include clear acceptance criteria at epic level

template.structure:
# Epic: [Epic Title]
## Metadata - **Epic ID:** EPIC-[XXX] - **Status:** [Draft/Planned/In Progress/Completed] - **Priority:** [Critical/High/Medium/Low] - **Product Vision:** [Link to product vision document] - **Owner:** [Name] - **Target Release:** [Q1 2025]
## Epic Statement As [user persona], I need [capability] so that [business value].
## Business Value [Clear articulation of why this epic matters]
### User Impact [How users benefit from this epic]
### Business Impact [Quantified business outcomes] - [Metric 1]: [Expected improvement] - [Metric 2]: [Expected improvement]
## Problem Being Solved [Specific problem this epic addresses from product vision]
## Scope
### In Scope - [Capability 1] - [Capability 2] - [Capability 3]
### Out of Scope - [What is explicitly not included] - [Deferred to future epics]
## User Stories (High-Level) [List of major user stories that comprise this epic - not detailed yet]
1. **Story 1:** As [role], I want [feature] so that [benefit] 2. **Story 2:** As [role], I want [feature] so that [benefit] 3. **Story 3:** As [role], I want [feature] so that [benefit]
## Acceptance Criteria (Epic Level)
### Criterion 1 **Given** [context] **When** [user action] **Then** [system response]
### Criterion 2 **Given** [context] **When** [user action] **Then** [system response]
## Success Metrics
| Metric | Target | Measurement Method | |--------|--------|-------------------| | [Metric 1] | [Goal] | [How measured] | | [Metric 2] | [Goal] | [How measured] |
## Technical Considerations
### Architecture Impact [High-level technical changes required]
### Dependencies **Technical Dependencies:** - [System/service dependency 1] - [External API/library dependency 2]
**Epic Dependencies:** - **Depends On:** [EPIC-XXX: Must complete first] - **Blocks:** [EPIC-YYY: This epic must complete first]
### Risks & Mitigations
| Risk | Likelihood | Impact | Mitigation Strategy | |------|------------|--------|-------------------| | [Risk 1] | High/Med/Low | High/Med/Low | [Strategy] | | [Risk 2] | High/Med/Low | High/Med/Low | [Strategy] |
## Effort Estimation - **Complexity:** [Low/Medium/High] - **Estimated Story Points:** [Range: e.g., 80-120] - **Estimated Duration:** [e.g., 2-3 months] - **Team Size:** [e.g., 2 frontend, 2 backend, 1 QA]
## Milestones - **Milestone 1** (Week 4): [Deliverable] - **Milestone 2** (Week 8): [Deliverable] - **Milestone 3** (Week 12): [Deliverable]
## Definition of Done (Epic Level) - [ ] All user stories completed and accepted - [ ] Acceptance criteria met and validated - [ ] Code reviewed and merged - [ ] Tests passing (unit, integration, e2e) - [ ] Documentation updated - [ ] Performance benchmarks met - [ ] Security review completed - [ ] Deployed to production - [ ] Success metrics baseline captured
## Open Questions - [Question 1] - [Question 2]
## Related Documents - Product Vision: [Link] - Related ADRs: [Links] - Technical Specs: [Links] - User Research: [Links]

examples.example:
# Epic: User Authentication System
As a CLI tool user, I need secure authentication so that my data remains private and only I can access my account.
Business Value: - User Impact: Users can trust the tool with sensitive data - Business Impact: Reduces support tickets by 40% (no password reset requests initially)
High-Level Stories: 1. As a new user, I want to create an account so that I can use the tool 2. As a returning user, I want to log in securely so that I can access my data 3. As a security-conscious user, I want 2FA so that my account is extra secure
